The system is on the verge of not sliding upwards, so the net force along the incline is zero.
The force of friction is equal to the maximum static friction, which is equal to the kinetic friction.
The component of the gravitational force along the incline is mg sin θ.
The component of the applied force F along the incline is F cos θ.
The normal force is mg cos θ.
The frictional force is μN = μmg cos θ.
The net force along the incline is F cos θ - mg sin θ - μmg cos θ = 0.
Solving for F gives F = mg (sin θ + μ cos θ).
Substituting sin 37° = 0.6 and μ = 0.5, we get F = 4mg.
